results.title: Empire of the sun [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Robert Shapiro
results.brief_description: Jim Graham, a young Briton living a comfortable life in Shanghai, is separated from his parents following the Japanese invasion of China at the start of World War II. The separation leads to Jim being caught in an internment camp where he has to fend for himself. Cast includes John Malkovich, Christian Bale, Miranda Richardson and Nigel Havers. Based on the autobiographical novel by J. G. Ballard.

results.title: Emmet Otter's jug-band Christmas
results.brief_description: Emmet Otter and his mother Alice both enter a talent contest in an effort to win $50 and buy each other the ‘best’ Christmas present. Entering involve sacrifices, pawning their departed father’s tool kit and drilling a hole in Alice’s washboard to make a musical instrument. Both Alice and Emmet perform well but not good enough to beat the out of town contestants,’The Riverbottom Nightmares’. Initially it seems that their efforts have been futile but when they combine their talents they discover that they have the best Christmas ever. Based on the book by Russell and Lillian Hoban.

results.title: Emphysema: the facts
results.creator_credit: Richard Bluestein, American Lung Association and Amram Nowak Associates
results.brief_description: The function of normal lungs is shown and the processes due to cigarette smoking which affect the lung and cause emphysema. Normal lungs are shown and compared with lungs from an emphysema patient. Treatments, which can only alleviate the symptoms, are shown

results.title: Emma (Paltrow)
results.creator_credit: Douglas McGrath, Patrick Cassavetti, Steven Haft, Haft Entertainment and Matchmaker Films
results.brief_description: This 1996 film version of Jane Austen’s novel stars Gwyneth Paltrow as the clever, rich “heroine” of the film who thinks a little too highly of herself, and entertains herself by meddling in the affairs of others. The destructive potential of Emma’s fantasies is best shown in her treatment of her protegee Harriet Smith (Toni Collette). At the start of the film, a match is all but made between Harriet and farmer Robert Martin. Emma, however teaches her to aspire to better things, arranging a match between Harriet and Mr.Elton (Alan Cumming). When this fails (because he is in love with Emma), she urges Harriet to look elsewhere. And when Harriet announces that she has fallen in love with another man, Emma imagines the man to be Frank Churchill (Ewan McGregor). The self-destructiveness of her imaginings is only apparent to her when she finally realises that the man in question is Mr.Knightley (Jeremy Northam), with whom she realises no one can be with but herself! In describing the mischievous schemes and eventual humbling of Emma, the film loses no opportunity to poke ironic fun at the society and social mores of the day.

results.title: Emma
results.creator_credit: John Glenister, Martin Lisemore and BBC
results.brief_description: Often insensitive, but ever well-meaning, Emma Woodhouse, one of the most beloved of Jane Austen’s heroines, turns her hand at matchmaking the local vicar Mr. Elton with her friend Harriet Smith. Despite the disastrous consequences, it is Emma herself who finds happiness with long time friend Mr. Knightley, one of the few people who acts as the voice of reason and restraint. This splendid BBC dramatisation brings to life all the wit and humour of the novel. Stars Doran Godwin and John Carson as Emma and Mr. Knightley with Mollie Sugden and Fiona Walker.

results.title: Embrace
results.creator_credit: Kerreen Ely-Harper, Lindy Macauley, Arts Education, NMIT and Northern Metropolitan Institute of TAFE
results.brief_description:
Embrace, launched in May 2000 by the Minister for Community Services, is the second dance film produced by NMIT (Northern Melbourne Institute of TAFE) featuring dancers with disabilities. Having experience of Loup - a film commemorating the year of the ocean, the artists (in Embrace) further explored the notion of creative expression and different spaces for dancers with disabilities.
Embrace was filmed in the green surroundings of Merri Creek and in the urban landscape of concrete and graffiti at the St Georges Rd bypass. The movements and actions were a direct result of interactions between the dancers and the landscape. The film, filled with beauty, humour and warmth, explores the themes of Hamlet’s soliloquy to be or not to be, namely the themes of betrayal, alienation, desire to escape and the place of dreams in our waking lives.
Embrace was funded by the Australian Council for the Arts, the City of Boroondara, the Department of Human Services and NMIT. The dancers had the opportunity during the production to work with professional artists from diverse backgrounds and expertise.
Embrace was screened at numerous national and international film festivals including the Dance on Camera festival in New York, January 2001. The principal artist, Randal Aitkin, gave a live performance at the screening of Embrace in New York. The significance of that event lies in the fact that the NMIT dance student qualified to perform among the elite of world dancers while overcoming difficulties arising from intellectual disability. Excerpts from Embrace appeared in the Arte programs on the National French and German Television Networks between December 2001 and February 2002.

results.title: Emanuel Feuermann: cellist
results.creator_credit: Ernst Matray, Rudolph Polk, Walter Lowendahl and Artists Films
results.brief_description: Emanuel Feuermann, internationally known cellist, plays Dvorak’s Rondo, Opus 94, Spinning Song by Popper. He is accompanied by Theodore Saidenberg at the piano.

results.title: Elvis on tour
results.creator_credit: Robert Abel, Pierre Adigel and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Presents a portrait of Elvis Presley’s life. Shows Elvis speaking publicly for the first time about his life and career; rare footage of his early days; performance of his greatest hits including “Love me tender” and offstage moments.

results.title: Elvis: That's the way it is (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Denis Sanders, Rick Schmidlin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Elvis: That’s the way it is is a remastered, special edition of the original. This edition includes special features such as the original theatrical trailer and the restored documentary, “Patch it up: The restoration of ‘Elvis: That’s the way it is’”. The documentary is a great introduction to the original picture, providing insights into Elvis the performer, both on stage and in rehearsal. Those who worked and performed with Elvis add an intimacy that only further draws the viewer into the world of Elvis. His masterful performance and ease with the camera makes the feature throughly entertaining for both Elvis enthusiasts and novice alike.

results.title: Elton John live in Australia. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: This concert, in December 1986, before a capacity audience in the Sydney Entertainment Centre, was part of the “Tour de Force” series. Elton and his band are accompanied by the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra under the baton of conductor James Newton Howard. Rated: G
